VIDEO OF THE DAY
X Factor, we met the judges the day before the final: 'Gabbani wants to win'
Doping case
Sinner positive for the doping test, the coach speaks: 'I had never seen that spray'
The 23-year-old number one in the world has been tested positive for Clostebol, a steroid. The substance is contained in a spray that his physiotherapist would have used to treat a wound
Editorial staff
August 21, 2024 1:27 PM
Facebook
WhatsApp
Share
A few hours after the outbreak of the
Doping case
on Jannik
Sinner
, a positive result in some tests carried out in April, but considered innocent by the International Agency for the Integrity of Tennis, it is the athlete's coach who speaks: “The truth has come out, Jannik had no fault or negligence, and I hope he can overcome this situation, play and improve, putting this unfortunate story behind him,” coach Darren Cahill explained in an interview with “Espn”.
“We had known about all this for a few months and we knew that this was a very serious matter. In March - said the Australian coach - during the Indian Wells tournament, Giacomo Naldi, Sinner's physiotherapist, put his hand in his bag and cut his finger with a cutter that he used to treat calluses on Jannik's feet. It was an annoying injury. I didn't see anything: the only person who was in the room with him at that time was Umberto Ferrara, Jannik's athletic trainer.”
“The physiotherapist and the athletic trainer know what happened next.”
“Jannik didn't know either. I went into the room and saw that he was bandaging his finger,” Cahill continued. “I asked him what had happened and he replied that he had cut himself on his finger. I asked him if I could help him in any way but he replied that the injury was not a problem.”
